title: Reception: Chicago Research and Collections Fellows Network
short_description: Chicago-area peers and partner institutions that host research- or collections-based fellowships are invited to kick off the academic year at the museum with us
description:
The Art Institute invites Chicago-area peers and partner institutions that host research- or collections-based fellowships to join us for an academic-year kickoff event at the museum. Fellows at all levels are welcome, as are program directors, mentors, or supervisors who work with fellows.

This after-hours networking reception serves to welcome new scholars to Chicago as well as to give visibility to diverse projects, resources, and colleagues across the city.

The event features an exclusive tour with behind-the-scenes insights into the making of In a Cloud, in a Wall, in a Chair: Six Modernists in Mexico at Midcentury with exhibition curator Zoë Ryan, John H. Bryan Chair and Curator of Architecture and Design.

For further information about this event, contact AERdept@artic.edu.

Learn more about academic research and engagement at the Art Institute.
location: Griffin Court and Abbott Galleries, Enter via the Modern Wing
